column4: Hello everyone, I need some help. My daughters EeePC will connect to our wireless network, but has no internet access. There was access before, but it was in roaming mode and switched to a stronger network, and I pointed it back to our network. Now It doesn't connect to the internet. I can't ping out, and the DNS nameserver is pointed to my router correctly.
-> check if it has a good route table   route -n
There's nothing listed but the headings :/
-> that is your clue, no route, so it can not get to wherever
Now my next step is to figure out how to resolve it. :D
-> copy one from your working clients
I don't have any working clients, but I'll see what I can find with google
Thanks :D
-> those should be automatic, feed by the dhcp server
would that make it a router issue?
-> yeah
i apologize, i do have a working windows machine, it's just the ubuntu machine that doesn't work
-> in windows you use   route print
ok good, and did you mean just copy the contents, or would it have to be from another ubuntu machine?
-> you can not literally copy the contents, its the context you need to copy
-> those should be automatically performed by the dhclient
I didn't mean literally copy and paste :P well, like i said, it worked fine before i turned off roaming mode
-> you dont want roaming mode, lest you reallly are roaming
yeah, that's why i turned it off and pointed to my connection. that was the moment i lost an internet connection.
-> configure the settings accordingly once you uncheck roaming
-> should only be like the essid and use dhcp   on that nm window
